intro: Geoffraya purpurea, commonly known as the purple geoffraya, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, violet to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a velvety texture. Geoffraya purpurea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
